Wisdom: السُّكُوتُ عَلَى الْأَحْمَقِ أَفْضَلُ جَوَابِهِ [مِنْ جَوَابِهِ‏]
enWisdom: Keeping silent is the best response for a fool

Wisdom: بُعْدُ الْأَحْمَقِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ قُرْبِهِ وَسُكُوتُهُ خَيْرٌ مِنْ نُطْقِهِ
enWisdom: The remoteness of a fool is better than his nearness and his silence is better than his speech

Wisdom: مَوَدَّةُ الْأَحْمَقِ كَشَجَرَةِ النَّارِ يَأْكُلُ بَعْضُهَا بَعْضاً
enWisdom: The friendship of a fool is like a tree of fire, part of it consumes [its] other parts

Wisdom: مَوَدَّةُ الْحَمْقَى تَزُولُ كَمَا يَزُولُ السَّرَابُ وَتُقْشَعُ كَمَا يُقْشَعُ الضَّبَابُ
enWisdom: The friendship of a fool vanishes the way a mirage vanishes and is dispersed the way mist gets dispersed

Wisdom: لَا تَرْجُوَنَّ فَضْلَ مَنَّانٍ وَلَا تَأْتَمِنِ الْأَحْمَقَ وَالْخَوَّانَ
enWisdom: Never have hope in the favour of one who makes you feel obliged, and do not rely upon the fool and the traitor

Wisdom: لَا تُعَظِّمَنَّ الْأَحْمَقَ وَإِنْ كَانَ كَبِيراً
enWisdom: Never show respect to a fool, even if he is [apparently] great

Wisdom: لَا تُنَازِعِ السُّفَهَاءَ وَلَا تَسْتَهْتِرْ بِالنِّسَاءِ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ يُزْرِي بِالْعُقَلَاءِ
enWisdom: Do not dispute with the fools and do not be infatuated with women, for indeed this degrades the intelligent ones

Wisdom: لَا يُقَوِّمُ السَّفِيهَ إِلَّا مُرُّ الْكَلَامِ
enWisdom: Nothing corrects the dimwit but bitter [and harsh] speech

Wisdom: لَا يُنْتَصَفُ مِنْ سَفِيهٍ قَطُّ إِلَّا بِالْحِلْمِ عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Justice can never be sought from the foolish one except by being forbearing with him
Refraining from replying a dimwit is the best reply you can give him
One who enters the circle of dimwits is debased

Wisdom: مَنْ عَذَلَ سَفِيهاً فَقَدْ عَرَّضَ لِلسَّبِّ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: One who censures a dimwit has exposed himself to insult
